text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with a super simple amazingly
delicious tarragon walnut brown butter
sauce the French call it Bernadette
which I think just means brown butter or
actually hazelnut butter referring to
the color and the aroma but it could not
be simpler
it goes with almost any fish and you're
gonna love it
so let me show you how to make it you're
gonna throw a chunk of butter I will
have all the measurements on the site
you go throw a chunk of butter in a dry
saute pan on medium heat you're gonna
let it foam up give it a swirl once in a
while you're gonna cook it for about
it's hard to say about 6 to 10 minutes
until it turns a kind of light tan nutty
color see the foam see those milk solids
they kind of toast you're gonna smell a
really nice nutty aroma and once it gets
to that perfect light tan lightly
browned hazelnut color you're gonna
throw in some chopped walnuts now the
walnuts you got to be careful the only
way to screw this up is to burn the nuts
here so we're gonna throw the walnuts in
we're just gonna swish them around in
that hot butter still over medium heat
we're gonna switch them on that hot
butter for just one minute
after one minute we're gonna cool it
down with our fresh lemon juice be
careful you're gonna turn off the heat
as soon as that lemon juice comes to a
boil which is gonna be pretty much
instantaneously we're going to throw in
our fresh chopped tarragon so delicious
now because of the acid in the lemon
juice as soon as it hits that hot butter
it's gonna basically form a really quick
emulsification so the sauce will look
pretty nice if you let it sit it will
separate but if you throw it on the fish
right when you make it you're in
business a nice pinch of salt and this
sauce is done so cook your fish put it
on the plate spoon over the hot tarragon
walnut brown butter sauce so I just
sauteed a couple pieces of black cod any
white fish works for this tilapia
snapper sole bass you name it oh and by
the way with all due respect you anti
butter people because there's too high
calorie
do the math the fish is 200 calories
each tablespoon of that sauce is only
hundred calories so you're talking about
a four or 500 calorie entree relax enjoy
yourself
eat some butter you're gonna love this
give it a try all the ingredients are on
the site and as always enjoy
you
